subject: Creativity
title: The 20% Rule: Structured Creative Freedom
description: A 60-second lesson on The 20% Rule: Structured Creative Freedom.

hook.text: Gmail, Google News, and AdSense all emerged from Google's '20% time' â€” one day a week for personal projects.

buildup.text: 3M pioneered this in 1948 with '15% time.' A scientist used his to invent Post-it Notes.

discovery.text: Structured freedom works because it provides both autonomy (intrinsic motivation) and constraint (limited time).

twist.text: Google quietly reduced 20% time. Many employees say it became '120% time' â€” done on top of regular work.

climax.text: The principle survives: companies that allocate protected creative time consistently outperform those that don't.

punchline.text: Innovation needs a calendar slot, not just a suggestion box.
